title: Data Specifications
text: package requires specific input data columns risk calculation. demo dataset provided demonstrate expected format: Required columns include: Pregnancy details (twins, gestational age weeks) Maternal characteristics (age, height, weight, race) Medical history (chronic conditions, diabetes) Biophysical measurements (MAP, UtPI) Biochemical measurements (PlGF, PAPP-)
code: # Load the demo data demo_data <- get_demo_data() head(demo_data)

title: Data Specifications
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. calculate_pe_risk() function accepts data frame, converts row data list using row_to_list(). row_to_list() function processes standardizes specific columns. examples allowed disallowed values key columns:

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “” → Singleton pregnancy “monochorionic” → Twins (Monochorionic) “dichorionic” → Twins (Dichorionic) Disallowed: “singleton” (use “” instead) “mono” (use “monochorionic” instead) “di” (use “dichorionic” instead)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “yes” → Smoker “” → Non-smoker Disallowed: “y”, “n” (use “yes” “”) “true”, “false” (use “yes” “”)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed (numeric codes): 1 → White 2 → Black 3 → South Asian 4 → East Asian 5 → Mixed Disallowed: “white”, “black” (use numeric codes)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “diet ” “insulin” “insulin+metformin” “metformin”, “Metformin” Disallowed: “diet” “insulin + metformin” (spaces)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “” → included “mom”, “MoM” → MoM (multiples median) “raw”, “Raw” → Raw values Disallowed: “none” (use “”) “median”, “raw data” (use “mom” “raw”)

previous_headings: Data Specification > Allowed and Disallowed Strings
title: Data Specifications
text: Allowed: “delfia” → Delfia machine “kryptor” → Kryptor machine “roche” → Roche machine Disallowed: “kr” (use full names)

title: Data Specifications
text: verify convert dataset appropriate format: row_to_list() function automatically handles allowed strings issues warnings invalid values detected. ensures data passed FMF preeclampsia calculator adheres required standards.
code: # Validate dataset columns validate_columns(demo_data)  # Convert a data row to a parameter list data_row <- demo_data[1, ] params <- row_to_list(data_row)

title: Details
text: FMF risk calculator developed Fetal Medicine Foundation underlying model published following papers: (Wright et al. 2015; Tan et al. 2018; Wright, Wright, Nicolaides 2020). details , however, well documented must therefore considered experimental part.

title: Details
text: MoM values FMF calculator estimated model published Tan et al. (2018). regression equations produce log10 expected values, get actual MoM values: MoM=Measured10result. MoM = \frac{Measured}{10^{result}}.

title: Details
text: gestational age measurements taken used calculate MoM values. Note three dates used calculations: ga_at biophysical_at biochemical_at addition, user provides variable ga gestational age weeks date ga_at. Note CRL used calculations. gestational age blood sampling thus calculated ga plus number weeks biochemical_at ga_at (biochemical_at - ga_at). approach used MAP UtAPI, using biophysical_at. women previous pregnancies, gestational age delivery previous pregnancy given user. inter-pregnancy interval, however, calculated number years (package: number days divided 365.25) previous delivery date beginning current pregnancy (.e., ga_at minus ga*7 days).

title: Details
text: variables affecting MoMs truncated. limits follows (haven’t found reported): Weight, upper limit: 130 kg Previous interval, upper limit: 20 years

title: Details
text: variables involved calculation prior risk given table . regression model produce μ̂\hat{\mu} provided variables. σ\sigma fixed σ=6.8833\sigma = 6.8833. prior risk calculated cummulative probability normal distribution mean μ̂\hat{\mu} standard deviation σ\sigma value gg, gg gestational age interest (weeks). Important note: Whereas published papers states SLE APS increase risk PE, online FMF calculator seems give increased risk SLE APS present.

title: Details
text: variables truncated calculation prior risk. Note limits MoM calculations (given ). limits follows: Maternal age: lower 12 years, upper 55 years Maternal weight: lower 34 kg, upper 190 kg Maternal height: lower 127 cm, upper 198 cm GA delivery previous pregnancy: lower 24 weeks, upper 42 weeks Inter-pregnancy interval: lower 0.25 years, upper 15 years

title: Details
text: posterior risk pp gestational week GG calculated p(G)=∫24Gh(g)⋅p̃(g)dg∫24∞h(g)⋅p̃(g)dg p(G) = \frac{\int_{24}^{G} h(g) \cdot \tilde{p}(g) dg}{\int_{24}^{\infty} h(g) \cdot \tilde{p}(g) dg} p̃(g)\tilde{p}(g) prior risk week gg (described ), h(g)h(g) adjustment based MoM MAP, PlGF UtAPI (described ). Important: practice, integral diverged inputs upper limit ∞\infty. Therefore, used upper level 1e3. seems work fine (see validation). adjustment h(g)h(g) calculated MoMs (variables) given multivariate normal distribution first input log10 MoMs MAP, PI PlGF calculated . μ\mu MAP, UtAPI PlGF based gestational age gg following regression formula: μ=β0+β1⋅g,g<−β0/β1, \mu = \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot g,\,\,\,\,\, g < -\beta_0/\beta_1,  μ=0\mu = 0 g≥−β0/β1g \geq -\beta_0/\beta_1. coefficients covariance matrix follows: Please note: emdbook::dmvnorm() function bottleneck package haven’t found good way improving performance yet.
code: emdbook::dmvnorm(       < measured MoM for MAP, UtAPI, PlGF >,       mu = < mu for MAP, UtAPI, PlGF >,       Sigma = < Covariance Matrix >     )

title: Details
text: limits MoM values, values outside limits truncated calculations still reported un-truncated online FMF calculator. limits follows: Log10 MoM-MAP: lower: -0.1224076, upper: 0.12240759 Log10 MoM-PlGF: lower: -0.5655099, upper: 0.56550992 Log10 MoM-UtAPI: lower: -0.4216152, upper: 0.42161519

title: PERiskProfileR
text: PERiskProfileR R package designed calculate preeclampsia risk scores based first-trimester parameters using Fetal Medicine Foundation (FMF) algorithm. package provides local implementation risk calculations interface online FMF calculator.

title: PERiskProfileR
text: can install PERiskProfileR GitHub using devtools:
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("andjar/PERiskProfileR", ref = "main")

title: PERiskProfileR
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. Please see: Data Specifications simplicity, package includes demo data set can loaded follows: data set can act template see ow data structured.
code: demo_data <- get_demo_data()

title: PERiskProfileR
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. Please see: Data specification

title: PERiskProfileR
text: package calculates MoM values key biomarkers:
code: # Convert a data row to parameter list params <- row_to_list(demo_data[1,])  # Calculate MoMs for individual markers mom_map <- get_mom_map(params) mom_utpi <- get_mom_utpi(params) mom_plgf <- get_mom_plgf(params)  print(c(MAP_MoM = mom_map, UtPI_MoM = mom_utpi, PlGF_MoM = mom_plgf))

title: PERiskProfileR
text: Calculate preeclampsia risk using formula-based method: risk scores returned : risk_prior: Background risk based maternal characteristics risk: Final risk incorporating biomarker measurements
code: # Calculate risk for a single patient risk_results <- calculate_formula_risk(params, G = 37) print(risk_results)  # Calculate risk for multiple patients results_df <- calculate_pe_risk(   demo_data,   method = "formula",   report_as_text = FALSE,   G = 37 ) head(results_df[, c("risk_prior", "risk")])

title: PERiskProfileR
text: data set must adhere following standards processed. Please see: Data specification package can also submit data FMF online calculator:
code: # Calculate risk using online calculator online_results <- calculate_pe_risk(   demo_data,   method = "online",   save_responses = TRUE,   response_dir = "calculator_responses" )

title: PERiskProfileR
text: documentation retrieval, package can save FMF calculator response pages: saved HTML files contain: Original input data Calculated MoM values Prior final risk scores Additional details calculations
code: # Extract risk scores from saved HTML files saved_results <- extract_risk_scores_from_files(   response_dir = "calculator_responses",   report_as_text = FALSE )

title: PERiskProfileR
text: can compare results methods:
code: # Calculate risks using both methods formula_results <- calculate_pe_risk(demo_data, method = "formula") online_results <- calculate_pe_risk(demo_data, method = "online")  # Compare risk scores comparison <- data.frame(   Formula_Risk = formula_results$risk,   Online_Risk = online_results$risk ) print(comparison)

title: PERiskProfileR
text: package intended clinical use. risk calculations verified using official clinical tools. online calculator requires internet connectivity may subject rate limiting access restrictions. Note data sent external server. Always validate results ensure input data meets expected format ranges.

title: PERiskProfileR
text: package implements algorithm described : Tan , et al. Screening pre-eclampsia maternal factors biomarkers 11-13 weeks’ gestation. Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol. 2018;52:186-195.

title: Validation
text: Please note: validation data attached pre-calculated risk scores can loaded function get_validation_data() ensure correspondence values calculated offline online, validation data set 5000 women generated cover wide range possible combinations: acquire risk scores using formulas: Finally, acquire risk scores using online calculator: compare two sets risk scores, merge :
code: # Function to generate random samples from a parameter space sample_parameter_space <- function(parameter_ranges, n_samples = 2500) {   # parameter_ranges should be a list where each element is either:   # - a vector of discrete values to sample from   # - a numeric vector of length 2 specifying [min, max] for continuous variables    # Initialize result dataframe   result <- data.frame(matrix(nrow = n_samples, ncol = length(parameter_ranges)))   names(result) <- names(parameter_ranges)    # Sample each parameter   for (param_name in names(parameter_ranges)) {     param_range <- parameter_ranges[[param_name]]      if (length(param_range) == 2 && is.numeric(param_range)) {       # Continuous parameter: sample uniformly between min and max       result[[param_name]] <- runif(n_samples, min = param_range[1], max = param_range[2])     } else {       # Discrete parameter: sample with replacement from provided values       result[[param_name]] <- sample(param_range, n_samples, replace = TRUE)     }   }    return(result) }  parameter_ranges <- list(   # Pregnancy Details   twins = "no",   crl1 = NA,   crl2 = NA,   crl = 50,   ga = c(11.3, 14),   ga_at = "01-01-2024",    # Maternal Characteristics   dob = paste0("01-01-", seq(1985, 2006)),   height = c(150, 190),   weight = c(40, 180),   race = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5),   smoking = c("yes", "no", "no"),   mother_pe = c("yes", "no", "no"),   conception = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 2, 3),    # Medical History   chronic_hypertension = c("yes", "no", "no", "no", "no"),   diabetes_type_i = c("yes", "no", "no", "no", "no"),   diabetes_type_ii = c("yes", "no", "no", "no", "no"),   diabetes_drugs = c("diet only", "insulin", "insulin+metformin", "metformin"),   sle = c("yes", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no"),   aps = c("yes", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no", "no"),    # Obstetric History   previous = "no",   previous_pe = NA,   previous_delivered_at = NA,   previous_ga_weeks     = NA,   previous_ga_days      = NA,   previous_interval     = NA,    # Biophysical Measurements   map = c(60, 100),   utpi = c(0.8, 3),   biophysical_at = "01-01-2024",    # Biochemical Measurements   include_plgf = "raw",   include_pappa = "no",   plgf_mom = NA,   plgf = c(10, 80),   plgf_machine = c("delfia", "kryptor", "roche"),   pappa_mom = NA,   pappa = NA,   pappa_machine = NA,   biochemical_at = "01-01-2024" )   # Generate 2250 random parameter combinations, primipara samples <- data.table(sample_parameter_space(parameter_ranges, n_samples = 2250))  # Generate 500 random parameter combinations, primipara, custom MoM-PlGF parameter_ranges$include_plgf <- "mom" parameter_ranges$plgf <- NA parameter_ranges$plgf_machine <- NA parameter_ranges$plgf_mom <- c(0.5, 2.5)  samples <- rbind(samples,                  data.table(sample_parameter_space(parameter_ranges, n_samples = 500)))  # Generate 2250 random parameter combinations, multipara parameter_ranges$include_plgf <- "raw" parameter_ranges$plgf <- c(10, 80) parameter_ranges$plgf_machine <- c("delfia", "kryptor", "roche") parameter_ranges$plgf_mom <- NA  parameter_ranges$previous <- "yes" parameter_ranges$previous_pe <- c("yes", "no", "no") parameter_ranges$previous_delivered_at <- paste0("01-01-", seq(2000, 2023)) parameter_ranges$previous_ga_weeks     <- seq(24, 41) parameter_ranges$previous_ga_days      <- seq(0, 6)  samples <- rbind(samples,                  data.table(sample_parameter_space(parameter_ranges, n_samples = 2250)))  # Add ID column samples[, id := .I]  # Adjust parameters samples[, crl := 50] samples[diabetes_type_i == "yes", diabetes_type_ii := "no"] samples[diabetes_type_ii == "no", diabetes_drugs := "no"] samples <- samples[sample(seq(1, nrow(samples)), nrow(samples))]  # Remove either PlGF, MAP or UtAPI from a subsample, n = 1000 rows_to_select_from <- samples[include_plgf == "raw", id] selected_rows <- sample(rows_to_select_from, 1000)  for (i in selected_rows) {   remove_measurement <- sample(c("MAP", "UtAPI", "PlGF"), 1)   if (remove_measurement == "MAP") {     samples[id == i, map := NA]   }   if (remove_measurement == "UtAPI") {     samples[id == i, utpi := NA]   }   if (remove_measurement == "PlGF") {     samples[id == i, plgf := NA]     samples[id == i, include_plgf := "no"]     samples[id == i, plgf_machine := NA]     samples[id == i, biochemical_at := NA]   } }  # Introduce a few days delay in one of the dates, n = 500 for each rows_to_select_from <- samples[!is.na(biochemical_at) & ga > 12 & ga < 13, id] selected_rows <- sample(rows_to_select_from, 500) for (i in selected_rows) {   samples[id == i, biochemical_at := paste0(sample(seq(25, 31), 1), "-12-2023")] }  rows_to_select_from <- samples[!is.na(biophysical_at) & ga > 12 & ga < 13, id] selected_rows <- sample(rows_to_select_from, 500) for (i in selected_rows) {   samples[id == i, biophysical_at := paste0(sample(seq(25, 31), 1), "-12-2023")] }  fwrite(samples, file = "data_validation.csv") remove(samples) df <- fread("data_validation.csv") k <- calculate_pe_risk(   df,   method = "formula",   report_as_text = TRUE,   G = 37   ) fwrite(k, file = "data_validation_analytical.csv") remove(k) l <- calculate_pe_risk(   df, method = "online",   report_as_text = TRUE,   G = 37,   save_responses = TRUE   ) fwrite(l, file = "data_validation_online.csv") remove(l) dfk <- fread("data_validation_analytical.csv") dfl <- fread("data_validation_online.csv") df <- merge(   dfk,   dfl[, .(id, mom_MAP, mom_PI, mom_PlGF, risk_prior, risk)],   by = "id" )

what: Comparison of formula vs online calculations
title: Validation
text: validation data attached pre-calculated risk scores can loaded function get_validation_data(): , risk.x based formula risk.y based online calculations.
code: df <- get_validation_data()  df[, risk.x := as.numeric(gsub("1 in ", "", risk.x))] df[, risk.y := as.numeric(gsub("1 in ", "", risk.y))]

previous_headings: Comparison of formula vs online calculations
title: Validation
text: red line x = y:  Mean vs Difference:  Difference:  Note difference becomes even smaller round formula-based values three decimals:
code: ggplot(df, aes(mom_MAP.x, mom_MAP.y)) +   geom_abline(slope = 1, color = "red") +   geom_point() + coord_equal() +   labs(x = "Formula", y = "Online", caption = "MoM MAP") #> Warning: Removed 318 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). ggplot(df, aes((mom_MAP.x + mom_MAP.y) / 2, mom_MAP.y - mom_MAP.x)) +     geom_point() +    labs(x = "Mean", y = "Difference", caption = "MoM MAP") #> Warning: Removed 318 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). ggplot(df, aes(mom_MAP.y - mom_MAP.x)) +   geom_density() +   labs(x = "Online - Formula", y = "Density", caption = "MoM MAP") #> Warning: Removed 318 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density()`). ggplot(df, aes((round(mom_MAP.x, 3) + mom_MAP.y) / 2, mom_MAP.y - round(mom_MAP.x, 3))) +     geom_point() +    labs(x = "Mean", y = "Difference", caption = "MoM MAP") #> Warning: Removed 318 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). ggplot(df, aes(mom_MAP.y - round(mom_MAP.x, 3))) +     geom_density() +     labs(x = "Online - Formula", y = "Density", caption = "MoM MAP") #> Warning: Removed 318 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density()`).

previous_headings: Comparison of formula vs online calculations
title: Validation
text: red line x = y:  Mean vs Difference:  Difference:  Round three decimals:
code: ggplot(df, aes(mom_PI.x, mom_PI.y)) +   geom_abline(slope = 1, color = "red") +   geom_point() + coord_equal() +   labs(x = "Formula", y = "Online", caption = "MoM UtAPI") #> Warning: Removed 672 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). ggplot(df, aes((mom_PI.x + mom_PI.y) / 2, mom_PI.y - mom_PI.x)) +     geom_point() +    labs(x = "Mean", y = "Difference", caption = "MoM UtAPI") #> Warning: Removed 672 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). ggplot(df, aes(mom_PI.y - mom_PI.x)) +   geom_density() +   labs(x = "Online - Formula", y = "Density", caption = "MoM UtAPI") #> Warning: Removed 672 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density()`). ggplot(df, aes(mom_PI.y - round(mom_PI.x, 3))) +   geom_density() +   labs(x = "Online - Formula", y = "Density", caption = "MoM UtAPI") #> Warning: Removed 672 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density()`). ggplot(df, aes((round(mom_PI.x, 3) + mom_PI.y) / 2, mom_PI.y - round(mom_PI.x, 3))) +     geom_point() +    labs(x = "Mean", y = "Difference", caption = "MoM UtAPI") #> Warning: Removed 672 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`).

code: ggplot(df, aes(mom_PlGF.x, mom_PlGF.y)) +   geom_abline(slope = 1, color = "red") +   geom_point() + coord_equal() +   labs(x = "Formula", y = "Online", caption = "MoM PlGF") #> Warning: Removed 334 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). ggplot(df, aes((mom_PlGF.x + mom_PlGF.y) / 2, mom_PlGF.y - mom_PlGF.x)) +     geom_point() +    labs(x = "Mean", y = "Difference", caption = "MoM PlGF") #> Warning: Removed 334 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_point()`). ggplot(df, aes(mom_PlGF.y - mom_PlGF.x)) +   geom_density() +   labs(x = "Online - Formula", y = "Density", caption = "MoM PlGF") #> Warning: Removed 334 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range #> (`stat_density()`).

previous_headings: Comparison of formula vs online calculations
title: Validation
text: red line x = y:  Mean vs Difference:   Difference:
code: ggplot(df, aes(nrisk_prior.x, nrisk_prior.y)) +   geom_abline(slope = 1, color = "red") +   geom_point() + coord_equal() +   scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +   labs(x = "Formula", y = "Online", caption = "Prior risk") ggplot(df, aes((nrisk_prior.x + nrisk_prior.y) / 2, nrisk_prior.y - nrisk_prior.x)) +     geom_point() + scale_x_log10() +   labs(x = "Mean", y = "Difference", caption = "Prior risk") ggplot(df, aes((nrisk_prior.x + nrisk_prior.y) / 2, abs(nrisk_prior.y - nrisk_prior.x))) +     geom_point() + scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +     labs(x = "Mean", y = "Abs. Difference", caption = "Prior risk") #> Warning in scale_y_log10(): log-10 transformation introduced #> infinite values. ggplot(df, aes(nrisk_prior.y - nrisk_prior.x)) +   geom_density() +   labs(x = "Online - Formula", y = "Density", caption = "Prior risk")

previous_headings: Comparison of formula vs online calculations
title: Validation
text: red line x = y:  Mean vs Difference:   Difference:  guess related rounding (makes big impact whether “1 3” vs “1 4”) important thing, however, related threshold 1/100:
code: ggplot(df, aes(nrisk.x, nrisk.y)) +   geom_abline(slope = 1, color = "red") +   geom_point() + coord_equal() +   scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +   labs(x = "Formula", y = "Online", caption = "Risk score") #> Warning in scale_x_log10(): log-10 transformation introduced #> infinite values. ggplot(df, aes((nrisk.x + nrisk.y) / 2, nrisk.y - nrisk.x)) +     geom_point() + scale_x_log10() +   labs(x = "Mean", y = "Difference", caption = "Risk score") ggplot(df, aes((nrisk.x + nrisk.y) / 2, abs(nrisk.y - nrisk.x))) +     geom_point() + scale_x_log10() + scale_y_log10() +     labs(x = "Mean", y = "Abs. Difference", caption = "Risk score") #> Warning in scale_y_log10(): log-10 transformation introduced #> infinite values. ggplot(df, aes(nrisk.y - nrisk.x)) +   geom_density() +   labs(x = "Online - Formula", y = "Density", caption = "Risk score") df[, high_risk.x := nrisk.x > 0.01] df[, high_risk.y := nrisk.y > 0.01] table(df[, .(online = ifelse(nrisk.y > 0.01, "High", "Low"), formula = ifelse(nrisk.x > 0.01, "High", "Low"))]) #>       formula #> online High  Low #>   High 2672    0 #>   Low    14 2314

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester
code: if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("andjar/PERiskProfileR", ref = "main")

title: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester
text: calculate_pe_risk() function return following values MoM UtPI MoM PlGF MoM MAP Risk score based history Combined risk score
code: # Load library library("PERiskProfileR")  # Load demo data df <- get_demo_data()  # Calculate risk scores locally result <- calculate_pe_risk(df, method = "formula")  # Calculate risk scores online. This make take some time, and note that data will be sent to the FMF web site result <- calculate_pe_risk(df, method = "online")

title: Calculate Formula-Based Risk — calculate_formula_risk
text: Calculates overall risk preeclampsia using FMF algorithm

title: Calculate Formula-Based Risk — calculate_formula_risk
code: calculate_formula_risk(   form_data,   G = 37,   report_as_text = FALSE,   mom_MAP = NA,   mom_PI = NA,   mom_PlGF = NA,   truncation_of_mom = TRUE )

title: Calculate Formula-Based Risk — calculate_formula_risk
text: form_data List containing required maternal characteristics measurements G Numeric, gestational age cutoff risk calculation (default: 37) report_as_text Boolean, whether return risk formatted text (default: FALSE)

title: Calculate Formula-Based Risk — calculate_formula_risk
text: List containing: mom_MAP: MAP MoM value mom_PI: PI MoM value mom_PlGF: PlGF MoM value risk_prior: Prior risk value risk: Final calculated risk

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
text: Submits maternal characteristics measurements Fetal Medicine Foundation's online preeclampsia risk calculator retrieves results.

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
code: calculate_online_risk(   form_data,   save_responses = FALSE,   response_dir = "requests",   url = "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First",   row_id = NULL )

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
text: form_data list containing maternal characteristics measurements save_responses Boolean, whether save HTML responses (default: FALSE) response_dir String, directory path save responses (default: "requests") url String, FMF calculator URL (default: "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First") row_id String NULL, identifier response file (default: NULL)

title: Calculate Online Preeclampsia Risk — calculate_online_risk
text: List containing: status: "Success" "Error" content: HTML content successful code: HTTP status code error message: Error message applicable

title: Calculate Pre-eclampsia Risk Scores — calculate_pe_risk
text: Calculates pre-eclampsia risk scores patient data using either formula-based method querying online calculator. function can process individual batch data, support parallel processing large datasets.

title: Calculate Pre-eclampsia Risk Scores — calculate_pe_risk
code: calculate_pe_risk(   data,   id_column = "id",   method = c("formula", "online"),   report_as_text = FALSE,   G = 37,   save_responses = FALSE,   response_dir = "requests",   url = "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First",   verbose = TRUE,   parallel = NA )

title: Calculate Pre-eclampsia Risk Scores — calculate_pe_risk
text: data data frame containing patient information measurements id_column Character string specifying column name containing unique identifiers. present, sequential IDs generated. Default: "id" method Character string specifying calculation method use. Must either "formula" "online". Default: "formula" report_as_text Logical indicating whether return risk scores text rather numeric values. Default: FALSE G Numeric value specifying gestational age weeks. used method = "formula". Default: 37 save_responses Logical indicating whether save responses online calculator. applicable method = "online". Default: FALSE response_dir Character string specifying directory responses saved save_responses TRUE. Default: "requests" url Character string specifying URL online calculator. Default: "https://fetalmedicine.org/research/assess/preeclampsia/First" verbose Logical indicating whether display progress messages. Default: TRUE parallel Logical indicating whether use parallel processing. NA, parallel processing automatically enabled datasets 100 rows. Default: NA

title: Calculate Pre-eclampsia Risk Scores — calculate_pe_risk
text: data frame containing original data additional columns: mom_MAP: Multiple median mean arterial pressure mom_PI: Multiple median pulsatility index mom_PlGF: Multiple median PlGF risk_prior: Prior risk score risk: Final calculated risk score

title: Calculate Pre-eclampsia Risk Scores — calculate_pe_risk
text: function supports two methods calculating pre-eclampsia risk: Formula-based calculation using local implementation Online calculation using Fetal Medicine Foundation calculator large datasets (>100 rows), parallel processing automatically enabled unless explicitly disabled. function use available cores minus one parallel processing.

title: Calculate Pre-eclampsia Risk Scores — calculate_pe_risk
text: package intended clinical use!

title: Calculate Pre-eclampsia Risk Scores — calculate_pe_risk
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Calculate risk using formula method results <- calculate_pe_risk(patient_data, method = "formula")  # Calculate risk using online calculator and save responses results <- calculate_pe_risk(   patient_data,   method = "online",   save_responses = TRUE,   response_dir = "pe_responses" ) } # }

what: Extract Risk Scores from HTML Content — extract_risk_scores
title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML Content — extract_risk_scores
text: Extracts preeclampsia risk scores biomarker MoM values FMF calculator HTML response

title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML Content — extract_risk_scores
code: extract_risk_scores(html_content, report_as_text = FALSE)

title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML Content — extract_risk_scores
text: html_content String containing HTML response calculator report_as_text Boolean, whether return risks text fractions (default: FALSE)

title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML Content — extract_risk_scores
text: List containing: mom_MAP: Mean Arterial Pressure MoM mom_PI: Pulsatility Index MoM mom_PlGF: PlGF MoM risk_prior: Prior risk (numeric text) risk: Final risk (numeric text)

what: Extract Risk Scores from HTML File — extract_risk_scores_from_file
title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML File — extract_risk_scores_from_file
text: Reads HTML file extracts preeclampsia risk scores biomarker MoM values

title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML File — extract_risk_scores_from_file
code: extract_risk_scores_from_file(html_file, report_as_text = FALSE)

title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML File — extract_risk_scores_from_file
text: html_file String, path HTML file report_as_text Boolean, whether return risks text fractions (default: FALSE)

title: Extract Risk Scores from HTML File — extract_risk_scores_from_file
text: List containing risk scores MoM values (see extract_risk_scores)

what: Extract Risk Scores from Multiple HTML Files — extract_risk_scores_from_files
title: Extract Risk Scores from Multiple HTML Files — extract_risk_scores_from_files
text: Processes multiple HTML response files combines extracted risk scores data table

title: Extract Risk Scores from Multiple HTML Files — extract_risk_scores_from_files
code: extract_risk_scores_from_files(   response_dir = "requests",   data = NULL,   id_column = "id",   report_as_text = FALSE )

title: Extract Risk Scores from Multiple HTML Files — extract_risk_scores_from_files
text: response_dir String, directory containing HTML files (default: "requests") report_as_text Boolean, whether return risks text fractions (default: FALSE)

title: Extract Risk Scores from Multiple HTML Files — extract_risk_scores_from_files
text: data.table columns: file: Source file path mom_MAP: Mean Arterial Pressure MoM mom_PI: Pulsatility Index MoM mom_PlGF: PlGF MoM risk_prior: Prior risk risk: Final risk

title: Retrieve Demo Dataset — get_demo_data
text: function provides access demo dataset included package. dataset stored CSV file extdata directory package.

title: Retrieve Demo Dataset — get_demo_data
code: get_demo_data()

title: Retrieve Demo Dataset — get_demo_data
text: data.table object containing contents demo dataset.

title: Retrieve Demo Dataset — get_demo_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load the demo dataset demo_data <- get_demo_data() head(demo_data) } # }

title: Get Expected Column Names — get_expected_columns
text: Returns vector expected column names preeclampsia risk calculation data, including pregnancy details, maternal characteristics, medical history, measurements.

title: Get Expected Column Names — get_expected_columns
code: get_expected_columns()

title: Get Expected Column Names — get_expected_columns
text: Character vector containing expected column names

title: Get Expected Column Names — get_expected_columns
text: Column categories include: Pregnancy Details (twins, CRL measurements, gestational age) Maternal Characteristics (demographics, height, weight) Medical History (chronic conditions, diabetes) Obstetric History (previous pregnancies) Biophysical Measurements (MAP, UtPI) Biochemical Measurements (PlGF, PAPP-)

what: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
title: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
text: Calculates expected Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) based maternal characteristics medical history

title: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
code: get_expected_map(form_data, truncate = TRUE)

title: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
text: form_data list containing: ga: Numeric, gestational age weeks weight: Numeric, maternal weight kg height: Numeric, maternal height cm race: Integer (2=Afro-Caribbean) smoking: Boolean, smoking status chronic_hypertension: Boolean, presence chronic hypertension diabetes_type_i: Boolean, presence Type 1 diabetes diabetes_type_ii: Boolean, presence Type 2 diabetes mother_pe: Boolean, maternal history preeclampsia previous: Boolean, previous pregnancy status previous_pe: Boolean, previous preeclampsia status previous_interval: Numeric, interval since previous pregnancy years

title: Calculate Expected Mean Arterial Pressure — get_expected_map
text: Numeric value representing expected MAP

title: Calculate Expected PlGF Values — get_expected_plgf
text: Calculates expected Placental Growth Factor (PlGF) values based various maternal characteristics demographic factors. Implementation based Appendix S1 https://obgyn.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/uog.19112

title: Calculate Expected PlGF Values — get_expected_plgf
code: get_expected_plgf(form_data, truncate = TRUE)

title: Calculate Expected PlGF Values — get_expected_plgf
text: form_data list containing following elements: plgf_machine: Integer (1=DELFIA, 2=KRYPTOR, 3=COBAS) ga: Numeric, gestational age weeks weight: Numeric, maternal weight kg age: Numeric, maternal age years race: Integer (1=White, 2=Afro-Caribbean, 3=South Asian, 4=East Asian, 5=Mixed) smoking: Boolean, smoking status diabetes_type_i: Boolean, presence Type 1 diabetes diabetes_type_ii: Boolean, presence Type 2 diabetes conception: Integer (3=vitro fertilization) previous: Boolean, previous pregnancy status

title: Calculate Expected PlGF Values — get_expected_plgf
text: Numeric value representing expected PlGF value

what: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
title: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
text: Calculates expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index (UtAPI) based maternal characteristics

title: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
code: get_expected_utpi(form_data, truncate = TRUE)

title: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
text: form_data list containing maternal characteristics including: ga: Numeric, gestational age weeks weight: Numeric, maternal weight kg age: Numeric, maternal age years race: Integer (2=Afro-Caribbean, 4=East Asian, 5=Mixed) diabetes_type_i: Boolean, presence Type 1 diabetes previous: Boolean, previous pregnancy status previous_pe: Boolean, previous preeclampsia status

title: Calculate Expected Uterine Artery Pulsatility Index — get_expected_utpi
text: Numeric value representing expected UtAPI

code: get_mom_plgf(form_data, truncation = TRUE)

title: Calculate PlGF MoM — get_mom_plgf
text: form_data list containing: include_plgf: Integer (0=exclude, 1=use provided MoM, 2=calculate MoM) plgf_mom: Numeric, provided PlGF MoM include_plgf=1 plgf: Numeric, raw PlGF value include_plgf=2

title: Calculate PlGF MoM — get_mom_plgf
text: Numeric value representing PlGF MoM NA PlGF excluded

what: PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester — PERiskProfileR-package
title: PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester — PERiskProfileR-package
text: package based published Fetal Medicine Foundation (FMF) Risk Calculator preeclampsia, based first trimester parameters. Risk scores can calculated either locally automatically submitting data web form.

title: PERiskProfileR: Calculate Preeclampsia Risk Scores in First Trimester — PERiskProfileR-package
text: Maintainer: Anders Hagen Jarmund anders.h.jarmund@ntnu.(ORCID)

what: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: Converts single row patient data formatted list parameters preeclampsia risk calculation, performing necessary data transformations validation.

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
code: row_to_list(row, validate = TRUE)

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: row Data frame row vector containing patient data validate Boolean, whether validate column names (default: TRUE)

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: List processed parameters appropriate types formats

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: Performs following transformations: Calculates maternal age conception Converts categorical variables strings numeric codes Processes date fields Validates categorical inputs expected values Handles special cases diabetes medication biomarker data Input format expectations: Dates format "dd-mm-yyyy" "dd.mm.yyyy" Categorical variables (yes/) case-insensitive Twins status: "", "monochorionic", "dichorionic" Race: 1=White, 2=Black, 3=South Asian, 4=East Asian, 5=Mixed Biomarker inclusion: "", "mom", "raw" Biomarker machines: "delfia", "kryptor", "roche"

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
text: function issues warnings : Missing required columns Invalid categorical values Unexpected values medical history fields Invalid biomarker specifications

title: Convert Data Frame Row to Parameter List — row_to_list
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ patient_data <- data.frame(   twins = "no",   ga = 12,   height = 165,   weight = 70,   smoking = "no",   # ... other required fields ... ) params <- row_to_list(patient_data) } # }

title: Validate Data Frame Columns — validate_columns
text: Checks data frame contains required columns preeclampsia risk calculation

title: Validate Data Frame Columns — validate_columns
code: validate_columns(df)

title: Validate Data Frame Columns — validate_columns
text: df Data frame validate

title: Validate Data Frame Columns — validate_columns
text: List containing: valid: Boolean indicating required columns present missing_columns: Character vector missing required columns extra_columns: Character vector additional columns expected set message: Status message describing validation results
